summary.description: A technical, 1-sentence summary of the DevOps strategy.

description.description: Detailed infrastructure philosophy and SRE approach.

cloud_provider.description: Primary cloud provider. Must match project scale.

iac.description: Infrastructure as Code tool for automation.

tools.description: CI/CD tools (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins, etc.).

disaster_recovery.description: Disaster recovery and business continuity plan

services.name: prod-db
services.description: Primary PostgreSQL database for content and user data.

services.name: app-cluster
services.description: Kubernetes cluster hosting Next.js frontend and Node.js backend.

services.name: asset-store
services.description: S3 bucket for storing uploaded images and static assets.

services.name: global-cdn
services.description: CloudFront distribution for caching static assets and ISR pages.

services.name: cache-layer
services.description: ElastiCache Redis for API response caching and session management.

pipeline_stages.name: Lint & Test
pipeline_stages.goal: Ensure code quality and pass unit tests.

pipeline_stages.name: Build & Push
pipeline_stages.goal: Containerize applications and store in registry.

pipeline_stages.name: Deploy Staging
pipeline_stages.goal: Deploy to staging environment and run integration tests.

environments.name: development
environments.description: Local or ephemeral environment for feature development.

environments.name: production
environments.description: Live environment serving real user traffic.

deployment.rollback_strategy: Automated rollback via Helm if health checks fail within 5 minutes of deployment.

containerization.docker_compose:
version: '3.8'
services:
  db:
    image: postgres:15
  api:
    build: ./backend
  web:
    build: ./frontend
containerization.dockerfile:
FROM node:18-alpine AS builder
WORKDIR /app
COPY . .
RUN npm ci && npm run build
FROM node:18-alpine AS runner
COPY --from=builder /app/.next ./.next
CMD ["npm", "start"]

disaster_recovery.backup_strategy: Daily automated snapshots of RDS with 7-day retention. WAL logs archived to S3 every 5 minutes for Point-in-Time Recovery. S3 assets replicated to a secondary region.
disaster_recovery.failover_plan: Manual promotion of Read Replica in secondary region to Primary. DNS failover via Route53 to secondary region Load Balancer.

content.summary: Cloud-native AWS architecture utilizing EKS for orchestration, RDS for data persistence, and Terraform for IaC to ensure a scalable, secure, and high-performance blog platform.
content.description: We implement a robust DevSecOps strategy centered on AWS EKS to manage the Next.js and Node.js microservices. Infrastructure is fully defined in Terraform for reproducibility. We utilize a rolling deployment strategy to ensure zero downtime. Observability is handled via Prometheus/Grafana, and security is enforced through strict IAM policies and network segmentation. Data integrity is guaranteed via multi-AZ RDS deployments and cross-region S3 replication.
